trans-unit.source: Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use a custom domain name with a web app in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use a custom domain name with a web app in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: When you create a web app, Azure assigns it to a subdomain of azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: When you create a web app, Azure assigns it to a subdomain of azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your web app is named contoso, the URL is contoso.azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your web app is named contoso, the URL is contoso.azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: Azure also assigns a virtual IP address.
trans-unit.target: Azure also assigns a virtual IP address.

trans-unit.source: For a production web app, you probably want users to see a custom domain name.
trans-unit.target: For a production web app, you probably want users to see a custom domain name.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to reserve or configure a custom domain with <link><linkText>App Service Web Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to reserve or configure a custom domain with <link><linkText>App Service Web Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: If you have a domain name already, or you want reserve domain from other domain registrars, here are the general steps to bring a custom domain name for web app:
trans-unit.target: If you have a domain name already, or you want reserve domain from other domain registrars, here are the general steps to bring a custom domain name for web app:

trans-unit.source: Reserve your domain name.
trans-unit.target: Reserve your domain name.

trans-unit.source: This article does not cover that process.
trans-unit.target: This article does not cover that process.

trans-unit.source: There are many domain registrars to choose from.
trans-unit.target: There are many domain registrars to choose from.

trans-unit.source: When you sign up, their site will walk you through the process.
trans-unit.target: When you sign up, their site will walk you through the process.

trans-unit.source: Create DNS records that map the domain to your Azure web app.
trans-unit.target: Create DNS records that map the domain to your Azure web app.

trans-unit.source: Add the domain name inside the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Add the domain name inside the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Within this basic outline, there are specific cases to consider:
trans-unit.target: Within this basic outline, there are specific cases to consider:

trans-unit.source: Mapping your root domain.
trans-unit.target: Mapping your root domain.

trans-unit.source: The root domain is the domain that you reserved with the domain registrar.
trans-unit.target: The root domain is the domain that you reserved with the domain registrar.

trans-unit.source: For example, contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: Mapping a subdomain.
trans-unit.target: Mapping a subdomain.

trans-unit.source: For example, blogs.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, blogs.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: You can map different subdomains to different web apps.
trans-unit.target: You can map different subdomains to different web apps.

trans-unit.source: Mapping a wildcard.
trans-unit.target: Mapping a wildcard.

trans-unit.source: For example, \*.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, \*.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: A wildcard entry applies to all subdomains of your domain.
trans-unit.target: A wildcard entry applies to all subdomains of your domain.

trans-unit.source: DNS record types
trans-unit.target: DNS record types

trans-unit.source: The Domain Name System (DNS) uses data records to map domain names into IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: The Domain Name System (DNS) uses data records to map domain names into IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: There are several types of DNS records.
trans-unit.target: There are several types of DNS records.

trans-unit.source: For web apps, you’ll create either an A record or a CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: For web apps, you’ll create either an A record or a CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: An A (Address) record maps a domain name to an IP address.
trans-unit.target: An A (Address) record maps a domain name to an IP address.

trans-unit.source: A CNAME (Canonical Name) record maps a domain name to another domain name.
trans-unit.target: A CNAME (Canonical Name) record maps a domain name to another domain name.

trans-unit.source: DNS uses the second name to look up the address.
trans-unit.target: DNS uses the second name to look up the address.

trans-unit.source: Users still see the first domain name in their browser.
trans-unit.target: Users still see the first domain name in their browser.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could map contoso.com to .azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could map contoso.com to .azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: If the IP address changes, a CNAME entry is still valid, whereas an A record must be updated.
trans-unit.target: If the IP address changes, a CNAME entry is still valid, whereas an A record must be updated.

trans-unit.source: However, some domain registrars do not allow CNAME records for the root domain or for wildcard domains.
trans-unit.target: However, some domain registrars do not allow CNAME records for the root domain or for wildcard domains.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you must use an A record.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you must use an A record.

trans-unit.source: The IP address may change if you delete and recreate your web app, or change the web app mode back to free.
trans-unit.target: The IP address may change if you delete and recreate your web app, or change the web app mode back to free.

trans-unit.source: Find the virtual IP address
trans-unit.target: Find the virtual IP address

trans-unit.source: Skip this step if you are creating a CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: Skip this step if you are creating a CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: To create an A record, you need the virtual IP address of your web app.
trans-unit.target: To create an A record, you need the virtual IP address of your web app.

trans-unit.source: To get the IP address:
trans-unit.target: To get the IP address:

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click the Browse option on the left side of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click the Browse option on the left side of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click the Web Apps blade.
trans-unit.target: Click the Web Apps blade.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of your web app.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of your web app.

trans-unit.source: In the Essentials page, click All settings.
trans-unit.target: In the Essentials page, click All settings.

trans-unit.source: Click Custom domains and SSL.
trans-unit.target: Click Custom domains and SSL.

trans-unit.source: In the Custom domains and SSL blade, click Bring External Domains".
trans-unit.target: In the Custom domains and SSL blade, click Bring External Domains".

trans-unit.source: The IP address is located at the bottom of this part.
trans-unit.target: The IP address is located at the bottom of this part.

trans-unit.source: Create the DNS records
trans-unit.target: Create the DNS records

trans-unit.source: Log in to your domain registrar and use their tool to add an A record or CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your domain registrar and use their tool to add an A record or CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: Every registrar’s web app is slightly different, but here are some general guidelines.
trans-unit.target: Every registrar’s web app is slightly different, but here are some general guidelines.

trans-unit.source: Find the page for managing DNS records.
trans-unit.target: Find the page for managing DNS records.

trans-unit.source: Look for links or areas of the site labeled Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.
trans-unit.target: Look for links or areas of the site labeled Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.

trans-unit.source: Often the link can be found be viewing your account information, and then looking for a link such as My domains.
trans-unit.target: Often the link can be found be viewing your account information, and then looking for a link such as My domains.

trans-unit.source: When you find the management page, look for a link that lets you add or edit DNS records.
trans-unit.target: When you find the management page, look for a link that lets you add or edit DNS records.

trans-unit.source: This might be listed as a Zone file, DNS Records, or as an Advanced configuration link.
trans-unit.target: This might be listed as a Zone file, DNS Records, or as an Advanced configuration link.

trans-unit.source: The page might list A records and CNAME records separately, or else provide a drop-down to select the record type.
trans-unit.target: The page might list A records and CNAME records separately, or else provide a drop-down to select the record type.

trans-unit.source: Also, it might use other names for the record types, such as IP Address record instead of A record, or Alias Record instead of CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: Also, it might use other names for the record types, such as IP Address record instead of A record, or Alias Record instead of CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: Usually the registrar creates some records for you, so there may already be records for the root domain or common subdomains, such as www.
trans-unit.target: Usually the registrar creates some records for you, so there may already be records for the root domain or common subdomains, such as www.

trans-unit.source: When you create or edit a record, the fields will let you map your domain name to an IP address (for A records) or another domain (for CNAME records).
trans-unit.target: When you create or edit a record, the fields will let you map your domain name to an IP address (for A records) or another domain (for CNAME records).

trans-unit.source: For a CNAME record, you will map from your custom domain to your azurewebsites.net subdomain.
trans-unit.target: For a CNAME record, you will map from your custom domain to your azurewebsites.net subdomain.

trans-unit.source: In many registrar tools, you will just type the subdomain portion of your domain, not the entire domain name.
trans-unit.target: In many registrar tools, you will just type the subdomain portion of your domain, not the entire domain name.

trans-unit.source: Also, many tools use ‘@’ to mean the root domain.
trans-unit.target: Also, many tools use ‘@’ to mean the root domain.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Host
trans-unit.target: Host

trans-unit.source: Record type
trans-unit.target: Record type

trans-unit.source: IP Address or URL
trans-unit.target: IP Address or URL

trans-unit.source: A (address)
trans-unit.target: A (address)

trans-unit.source: www
trans-unit.target: www

trans-unit.source: CNAME (alias)
trans-unit.target: CNAME (alias)

trans-unit.source: contoso.azurewebsites.net
trans-unit.target: contoso.azurewebsites.net

trans-unit.source: Assuming the custom domain name is ‘contoso.com’, this would create the following records:
trans-unit.target: Assuming the custom domain name is ‘contoso.com’, this would create the following records:

trans-unit.source: contoso.com mapped to 127.0.0.1.
trans-unit.target: contoso.com mapped to 127.0.0.1.

trans-unit.source: www.contoso.com mapped to contoso.azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: www.contoso.com mapped to contoso.azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: You can use Azure DNS to host the necessary domain records for your web app.
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure DNS to host the necessary domain records for your web app.

trans-unit.source: To configure your custom domain, and create your records, in Azure DNS, see <link><linkText>Create custom DNS records for a web app</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To configure your custom domain, and create your records, in Azure DNS, see <link><linkText>Create custom DNS records for a web app</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create an awverify record (A records only)
trans-unit.target: Create an awverify record (A records only)

trans-unit.source: If you create an A record, web app also requires a special CNAME record, which is used to verify that you own the domain you are attempting to use.
trans-unit.target: If you create an A record, web app also requires a special CNAME record, which is used to verify that you own the domain you are attempting to use.

trans-unit.source: This CNAME record must have the following form.
trans-unit.target: This CNAME record must have the following form.

trans-unit.source: If the A record maps the root domain or a wildcard domain: Create a CNAME record that maps from awverify. to awverify..azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: If the A record maps the root domain or a wildcard domain: Create a CNAME record that maps from awverify. to awverify..azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the A record is for contoso.com, create a CNAME record for awverify.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the A record is for contoso.com, create a CNAME record for awverify.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: If the A record maps a specific subdomain: Create a CNAME record that maps from awverify. to awverify..azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: If the A record maps a specific subdomain: Create a CNAME record that maps from awverify. to awverify..azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the A record is for blogs.contoso.com, create a CNAME record for awverify.blogs.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the A record is for blogs.contoso.com, create a CNAME record for awverify.blogs.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: Visitors to your web app will not see the awverify subdomain; it’s only for Azure to verify your domain.
trans-unit.target: Visitors to your web app will not see the awverify subdomain; it’s only for Azure to verify your domain.

trans-unit.source: Enable the domain name on your web app
trans-unit.target: Enable the domain name on your web app

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For more information please see: <link><linkText>Get started with Azure DNS</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Delegate Domain to Azure DNS</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more information please see: <link><linkText>Get started with Azure DNS</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Delegate Domain to Azure DNS</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>
